page.title: 17Oldmeldrum & Bourtie Churchs
page.content: Oldmeldrum and the adjoining parishes of Meldrum and Bourtie have a combined population of 2,225 and by far the greatest number of churchgoers are members of the church of Scotland, attending Meldrum Parish Church, east of town. Its membership roll for the united parishes of Meldrum and Bourtie is 730, with 60 of those residents of Bourtie and attending Bourtie Kirk. Of the 730 presbyterians, on average 130 turn up to the weekly service in Oldmeldrum; there is a family service once a month. Between 12 and 20 attend the twice-monthy services at Bourtie. Th number is higher for twice-yearly communion services. For the episcopalian St Matthew's Church on the north of the town, the communicant roll is 62, with an average attendance of 25 each sunday for communion. Roman Catholics attend a church in Inverurie
